meanings.definition: A small tuft or cluster of wool, cotton, or similar material.
meanings.sent1: The floccules of cotton were soft to the touch.
meanings.sent2: She picked off the tiny floccules of wool from her sweater.
meanings.sent3: The floccules of cotton danced in the breeze like tiny clouds.
meanings.sent4: The floccules of wool clung together like a family, never wanting to separate.
meanings.sent5: The floccules of cotton looked like little snowflakes scattered on the ground.

meanings.definition: A small, loosely aggregated mass or tuft.
meanings.sent1: The floccules of dust gathered in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The painter carefully added floccules of paint to create texture in the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The floccules of popcorn on his plate seemed to be having a party.
meanings.sent4: The floccules of clouds in the sky resembled fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: The floccules of feathers floated gently in the air like delicate snowflakes.
